articles.title: Apple's Still Behind In The AI Race: AI Fund Manager
articles.content: The Vaule of AI will be immense, but exactly where the biggest gains lie still needs to be determined, highlighting that Meta's AI investment is a rational, strategic move. He speaks with Katie Greifeld and Romaine Bostick on "The Close."

articles.title: Apple projects tariff costs will hit $1.1B next quarter
articles.content: While sales growth suggests fear of tariffs helped fuel sales, Cook downplayed the “pull forward” effect, noting that consumers were more motivated by the “strength of the product.”

articles.title: Apple Growth Rebounds on Strength of iPhone 16 Line, China
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. reported its fastest quarterly revenue growth in more than three years, easily topping Wall Street estimates, after demand picked up for the iPhone and products in China. articles.title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures slip as Trump reveals sweeping global tariffs, raises rate on Canada
articles.content: US stock futures slipped as investors digested the latest Big Tech earnings ahead of a pivotal Friday, with President Trump's trade deadline and the July jobs report both on deck.

articles.title: Apple Expects $1.1 Billion Hit From Tariffs This Quarter, CEO Tim Cook Says
articles.content: Apple is preparing to absorb $1.1 billion in tariff costs this quarter, CEO Tim Cook told investors on Thursday's earnings call.

articles.title: Apple quietens Wall Street’s fears of China struggles and slow AI progress
articles.content: Tech giant sees double-digit revenue rise, with huge gains in iPhone sales, despite stock-price drop and looming tariffs

articles.title: Alger CEO on Microsoft, Meta, Apple, Amazon
articles.content: Alger CEO Dan Chung says AI is in its early stages after Microsoft and Meta soared following their earnings. He also discussed Apple and says we would need to see an "exciting product cycle" to boost holdings. He speaks with Katie Greifeld and Romaine Bostick on "The Close."

articles.title: Apple got a much-needed iPhone and China boost, but expects a $1.1 billion tariff hit this quarter
articles.content: Apple reported strong iPhone sales and rebound in revenue from China, giving a much-needed boost to two parts of the company’s business that had struggled over the past year.

articles.title: Podcast: U.S. Stocks Drop as Tariff Deadline Nears
articles.content: U.S. stocks closed lower as the Friday deadline for new tariffs weighed on investors, though the timeline for reaching a trade deal with Mexico got a 90-day extension. Shares in Microsoft rose 4% on a strong earnings report, briefly pushing its market value above $4 trillion.

articles.title: Apple Stock Is Up 2.3% After Earnings Call Concludes
articles.content: After posting better-than-expected third-quarter financials and positive guidance, Apple investors were pleased. Shares of the iPhone maker rose 2.3% in after-hours trading, after company's latest earnings call wrapped.
